title: Reconstruction of Anosov flows from infinity
authors: Hyungryul Baik, Chenxi Wu, Bojun Zhao
abstract:
Every pseudo-Anosov flow $\phi$ in a closed $3$-manifold $M$ gives rise to an
action of $\pi_1(M)$ on a circle $S^{1}_{\infty}(\phi)$ from infinity
\cite{Fen12}, with a pair of invariant \emph{almost} laminations. From certain
actions on $S^{1}$ with invariant almost laminations, we reconstruct flows and
manifolds realizing these actions, including all orientable transitive
pseudo-Anosov flows in closed $3$-manifolds. Denoting the Poincar\'e disk by
$\mathcal{D}$, our construction provides a geometry model for such flows $\phi$
and manifolds $M$ by identifying the universal coverings of $M$ with certain
spaces induced from $\mathcal{D} \times \mathcal{D}$ and identifying the action
of $\pi_1(M)$ on $S^{1}_{\infty}(\phi)$ with an action on $\partial
\mathcal{D}$.
